page.title: 02INTERVIEW-RETIRED FARMWORKER
page.content: The retired farmworker was asked several questions.A summary follows "Cabourne Parva is a farm which stands in the middle of its farming area unlike new farms today which are built near major lines of communications. The farm has nine furrow reversible plough for ploughing straight up and down the field by turning upside down where there is another nine shares. A large set of spring-tine harrows which are used for raking the top soil where the soil is chalky or stoney. An artificial manure spreader, a huge set of discs which are used for breaking up the soil and some sprayers. There are two Case tractors, two John Deere and a Massey Ferguson tractor. There is also a twelve foot bed International combine. This machinery is purchased from Caistor.
